meanings.definition: To surpass in catching or capturing.
meanings.sent1: The skilled hunter was able to outcatch all the other competitors in the contest.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah can outcatch its prey with its incredible speed.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel tried to outcatch the mischievous chipmunk in a playful game of tag.
meanings.sent4: The spider's web was strategically placed to outcatch unsuspecting insects.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman's net was designed to outcatch a large number of fish at once.

meanings.definition: To outdo in catching or capturing.
meanings.sent1: The agile cat can outcatch any mouse that enters its territory.
meanings.sent2: The skilled fisherman knows how to outcatch the biggest fish in the lake.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tried to outcatch the sneaky raccoon in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The spider's web was strategically placed to outcatch unsuspecting insects.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web was designed to outcatch any prey that comes its way.
